name: Lagavulin
history: Founded in 1816, Lagavulin is one of the oldest distilleries on Islay. The distillery is known for its powerful, smoky whiskies.
production_notes: Known for heavily peated whisky with a distinctive rich, smoky character.

name: Laphroaig
history: Established in 1815, Laphroaig has been producing whisky for over 200 years. The name means 'the beautiful hollow by the broad bay'.
production_notes: Famous for its bold, smoky flavor with notes of seaweed and medicinal peat.

name: Ardbeg
history: Founded in 1815, Ardbeg is located on the southern coast of Islay. The distillery has experienced several closures but was revived in 1997.
production_notes: Produces heavily peated whisky with complex smoky and citrus notes.

name: The Macallan
history: The Macallan has been producing whisky since 1824 and is one of the world's best-selling single malts.
production_notes: Known for sherry cask maturation producing rich, fruity whiskies.

name: Glenfiddich
history: Founded in 1887 by William Grant, Glenfiddich means 'Valley of the Deer' in Gaelic.
production_notes: Pioneer of single malt whisky marketing, known for approachable, fruity expressions.

name: The Glenlivet
history: One of the first licensed distilleries in Scotland, The Glenlivet has set the standard for Speyside malts.
production_notes: Known for its smooth, floral and fruity character.

name: Highland Park
history: Located in Orkney, Highland Park is the most northerly distillery in Scotland.
production_notes: Uses heather-rich peat giving a distinctive honeyed smoke character.

name: Talisker
history: The only distillery on the Isle of Skye, Talisker has been producing whisky since 1830.
production_notes: Known for its powerful, peppery maritime character.

name: Bowmore
history: Established in 1779, Bowmore is one of the oldest licensed distilleries in Scotland.
production_notes: Produces balanced peated whiskies with tropical fruit notes.

name: Springbank
history: Family-owned since 1828, Springbank is one of the few distilleries that performs 100% of production on-site.
production_notes: Produces three distinct styles: Springbank, Longrow (peated), and Hazelburn (unpeated).

name: Oban
history: One of Scotland's oldest distilleries, Oban predates the town it sits in.
production_notes: Produces a distinctive style bridging Highland and Island characters.

name: Dalmore
history: Founded in 1839, Dalmore is known for its distinctive stag emblem and luxury releases.
production_notes: Famous for sherry cask maturation and chocolate-orange notes.

name: Glenmorangie
history: Home to Scotland's tallest stills, Glenmorangie has been making whisky since 1843.
production_notes: Known for its tall stills and pioneering wood finishes.

name: Aberlour
history: Founded in 1879 at the confluence of the Lour Burn and the River Spey.
production_notes: Known for rich, sherried expressions with fruit and spice.

name: Balvenie
history: Sister distillery to Glenfiddich, Balvenie maintains traditional floor maltings.
production_notes: Known for honeyed, vanilla-rich expressions and innovative cask finishes.

name: Caol Ila
history: Islay's largest distillery, Caol Ila means 'Sound of Islay'.
production_notes: Produces elegant, citrusy peated whisky.

name: Bunnahabhain
history: Located in a remote corner of Islay, Bunnahabhain means 'mouth of the river'.
production_notes: Known for its unpeated core range, unique among Islay distilleries.

name: Bruichladdich
history: Revived in 2001, Bruichladdich is known for innovation and transparency.
production_notes: Produces unpeated Bruichladdich, heavily peated Port Charlotte, and super-peated Octomore.

name: Jameson (Midleton)
history: Ireland's best-selling whiskey, now produced at Midleton Distillery.
production_notes: Triple-distilled for smoothness with a blend of pot still and grain whiskey.

name: Redbreast (Midleton)
history: One of the few remaining pure pot still Irish whiskeys.
production_notes: Rich, complex single pot still whiskey with sherry influence.

name: Bushmills
history: Claims to be the world's oldest licensed distillery, granted a license in 1608.
production_notes: Triple-distilled Irish single malt with a smooth, honeyed character.

name: Buffalo Trace
history: One of America's oldest continuously operating distilleries.
production_notes: Home to Buffalo Trace, Eagle Rare, and the legendary Pappy Van Winkle.

name: Maker's Mark
history: Founded in 1953, Maker's Mark pioneered the wheated bourbon style.
production_notes: Uses red winter wheat instead of rye for a softer, sweeter bourbon.

name: Wild Turkey
history: Master Distiller Jimmy Russell has been with Wild Turkey since 1954.
production_notes: Known for bold, spicy bourbons aged in heavily charred barrels.

name: Woodford Reserve
history: Located at Kentucky's oldest and smallest distillery.
production_notes: Triple-distilled in copper pot stills for a refined, complex bourbon.

name: Jack Daniel's
history: America's oldest registered distillery and best-selling American whiskey.
production_notes: Charcoal-mellowed through sugar maple for the Tennessee whiskey character.

name: Yamazaki
history: Japan's first and oldest malt whisky distillery, founded by Shinjiro Torii.
production_notes: Uses diverse cask types including Mizunara oak for unique Japanese character.

name: Hakushu
history: Located in the Japanese Alps, known as the 'forest distillery'.
production_notes: Produces fresh, herbal whisky with subtle smoke from the mountain environment.

name: Yoichi
history: Founded by Masataka Taketsuru, the 'father of Japanese whisky'.
production_notes: Uses traditional coal-fired pot stills for a rich, peaty character.

name: Miyagikyo
history: Nikka's second distillery, built to create a different style than Yoichi.
production_notes: Produces elegant, fruity whisky using steam-heated stills.

name: GlenDronach
history: Founded in 1826, GlenDronach is renowned for its sherry-matured whiskies.
production_notes: Exclusively uses sherry casks for maturation.

name: Cragganmore
history: One of the classic malts of Scotland, known for complexity.
production_notes: Uses unique flat-topped stills producing a complex, smoky-sweet character.

name: Clynelish
history: Built in 1967 next to the original Brora distillery.
production_notes: Known for its waxy, honeyed coastal character.

name: Glen Scotia
history: One of only three remaining Campbeltown distilleries.
production_notes: Produces maritime-influenced whisky with light peat.

name: Kilchoman
history: Islay's farm distillery, producing whisky from barley grown on-site.
production_notes: One of Scotland's smallest distilleries, known for quality peated expressions.

name: Glenfarclas
history: Family-owned for six generations, one of the last independent Speyside distilleries.
production_notes: Known for sherry-matured expressions and excellent value.

name: BenRiach
history: Revived in 2004 after years of closure, known for innovative expressions.
production_notes: Produces both peated and unpeated expressions.

name: Glengoyne
history: Located on the Highland Line, with the distillery in the Highlands and warehouses in the Lowlands.
production_notes: Uses unpeated malt and slow distillation for a rich, fruity character.

name: Auchentoshan
history: One of the few remaining Lowland distilleries, triple-distilling all its whisky.
production_notes: Triple-distilled for a light, delicate character.

name: Crown Royal
history: Created in 1939 for the visit of King George VI to Canada.
production_notes: Blend of 50 distinct whiskies for a smooth, rich character.

name: Amrut
history: India's first single malt whisky producer, putting Indian whisky on the world map.
production_notes: Tropical maturation creates rapid aging and intense flavor.

name: Kavalan
history: Taiwan's first whisky distillery, quickly gaining international acclaim.
production_notes: Subtropical climate creates rapid maturation with intense tropical fruit notes.

name: Starward
history: Melbourne-based distillery focused on Australian wine barrel maturation.
production_notes: Uses Australian wine barrels for a unique fruit-forward character.

name: Chichibu
history: Founded by Ichiro Akuto, grandson of a legendary Japanese whisky maker.
production_notes: Small-batch production with Mizunara and various wine cask finishes.

name: Edradour
history: Scotland's smallest traditional distillery, producing whisky by hand.
production_notes: Traditional hand-crafted production with sherry cask focus.

name: Benromach
history: Reopened in 1998 after years of silence, owned by legendary bottlers Gordon & MacPhail.
production_notes: Produces lightly peated Speyside malt with traditional character.

name: Isle of Jura
history: The only distillery on the Isle of Jura, an island with more deer than people.
production_notes: Produces both lightly peated and heavily peated expressions.

name: Tobermory
history: The only distillery on the Isle of Mull, producing two distinct styles.
production_notes: Produces unpeated Tobermory and heavily peated Ledaig.
